column4: i installed a router, and all of a sudden, my internet connection is much slower
ping your router. see whether there are dropped packets.
, thanks, i have been trying to figure tat out forever
oh, I forgot I did that:)
PING www.l.google.com (64.233.167.99) 56(84) bytes of data. <---is that a bad thing?
it just means your router does not let you ping out.
Ok, then why would it be bad?
what is slow on your computer?
are you now on that computer?
Well, unless someone has a better idea, sudo invoke-rc.d networking restart, then see whether your /etc/resolv.conf is still the same. paste more than one line to pastebin.com
use sudo to edit the file, and leave only the second line in.
that is your router ip, right?
wasn't there a search belkin as a first line?
